include_in_recommendations.description:
Whether this image should be recommended as a base image upgrade. 
If set to true, this image could be shown as a base image upgrade to other projects.
If set to false this image will never be recommended as an upgrade.

project_id.description:
The ID of the container project that the custom base image is based off of.
The attributes of this custom base image are taken from the latest snapshot at the time of creation.
This means that no changes should be made to the original project after the creation of the custom base image,
as new snapshots created from any changes will NOT be picked up.

coordinates.description:
Where the issue originated, specific to issue type. Details on what
code, package, etc introduced the issue. An issue may be caused by
more than one coordinate.

correlation_id.description:
An optional identifier for correlating remedies between coordinates or across issues. They are scoped
to a single Project and test run. Remedies with the same correlation_id must have the same contents.

description.description: A markdown-formatted optional description of this remedy. Links are not permitted.

data.description: Metadata information related to apply a remedy. Limited in size to 100Kb when JSON serialized.

schema_version.description:
A schema version identifier the metadata object validates against. Note: this information is
only relevant in the domain of the API consumer: the issues system always considers metadata
just as an arbitrary object.

representations.description:
A list of precise locations that surface an issue.
A coordinate may have multiple representations. For example, a package vulnerability may be represented both
by its package dependency graph traversal, and by the location in a package manifest that introduced the
dependency.

Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Prototype Pollution.
The utilities function allow modification of the `Object` prototype.
If an attacker can control part of the structure passed to this function,
they could add or modify an existing property.

effective_severity_level.description:
The computed effective severity of this issue. This is either the highest level from all included severities,
or an overridden value set via group level policy.

ignored.description: A flag indicating if the issue is being ignored. Derived from the issue's ignore, which provides more details.

key.description: An opaque key used for uniquely identifying this issue across test runs, within a project.

problems.description: A list of details for vulnerability data, policy, etc that are the source of this issue.

disclosed_at.description: When this problem was disclosed to the public.

discovered_at.description: When this problem was first discovered.

updated_at.description: When this problem was last updated.

url.description: An optional URL for this problem.

severities.description: A list of severities given to this issue from associated source.

score.description:
A CVSS score for this severity, from 0 to 10 inclusive.
Scores may have a single significant decimal digit. This precision is enforced in the API.

source.description:
The source of this severity. The value may be the id of a
referenced problem or class, in which case that problem or class is
the source of this issue.

If source is omitted, this severity is sourced internally in the Khulnasoft application.

slots.description: Extension slots for type specific data, populated on issue creation. Limited in size to XX Kb when JSON serialized.

status.description: The issue's status. Derived from the issue's resolution, which provides more details.

title.description: A human-readable title for this issue.

tool.description: An opaque identifier for corelating across test runs.

ignore.description: An optional reference to an ignore rule that marks this issue as ignored.

data.description:
An optional list of references to a Policy rule that modified some details
about the Issue during processing.

previous.description:
A previous resolved occurance of this issue. If present, the issues will have the same key.
Multiple previous occurances may exist, and can be retrieved by following the "previous" chain.

test_executions.description:
The "test execution" that identified this Issues. This ID represents
a grouping of issues, that were identified by some analysis run, to produce
Issues.

VersioningSchema.description:
The versioning scheme used by images in the repository.

A versioning schema is a system for identifying and organizing different versions of a project. 
It is used to track changes and updates to the project over time, and to help users identify which version they are using. 
A versioning schema typically consists of a series of numbers or labels that are incremented to reflect the progression of versions. 
For example, a versioning schema might use a series of numbers, such as "1.0", "1.1", "2.0", and so on, to indicate major and minor releases of a product. 
A consistent and well-defined versioning schema helps users and tools understand and track the development of a project.

expression.description: The regular expression used to describe the format of tags.

label.description:
A customizable string that can be set for a custom versioning schema to describe its meaning.
This label has no function.

org_id.description:
The org ID that the versioning schema will be a part of.
This will be used for authorizing usage of the versioning schema resource.

get.description:
Get a list of custom base images with support for ordering and filtering.
Either the org_id or group_id parameters must be set to authorize successfully.

parameters.description: The group ID of the custom base image
parameters.name: group_id

200.description: Returns custom base images

get.summary: Get a custom base image collection

post.description:
In order to create a custom base image, you first need to import your base images into Khulnasoft.
You can do this through the CLI, UI, or API.

This endpoint marks an image as a custom base image. This means that the image will get
added to the pool of images from which Khulnasoft can recommend base image upgrades.

Note, after the first image in a repository gets added, a versioning schema cannot be passed in this endpoint.
To update the versioning schema, the PATCH endpoint must be used.

requestBody.description: The properties used in the creation of a custom base image

201.description: Successfully created a custom base image

post.summary: Create a Custom Base Image from an existing container project

delete.description: Delete a custom base image resource. (the related container project is unaffected)

204.description: Successfully deleted the custom base image

post.description: Create a service account for a group. The service account can be used to generate access tokens. Currently, we only allow group service accounts using default group roles.

parameters.description: The ID of the Khulnasoft Group that is creating and owns the service account
parameters.name: group_id

access_token_ttl_seconds.description: The time, in seconds, that a generated access token will be valid for. Defaults to 1 hour if unset. Only used when auth_type is oauth_private_key_jwt.

auth_type.description:
Authentication strategy for the service account:
  * api_key - Regular Khulnasoft API Key.
  * oauth_private_key_jwt - OAuth2 client_credentials grant, using private_key_jwt client_assertion as laid out in OIDC Connect Core 1.0, section 9.

jwks_url.description: A JWKs URL hosting your public keys, used to verify signed JWT requests. Must be https. Required only when auth_type is oauth_private_key_jwt.

name.description: A human-friendly name for the service account.

role_name.description: The name of the role which the created service account should use. Available roles include 'Group Admin', 'Group Member' and 'Group Viewer'.

access_token_ttl_seconds.description: The time, in seconds, that a generated access token will be valid for. Defaults to 1hr if unset. Only provided when auth_type is oauth_private_key_jwt.

api_key.description: The Khulnasoft API Key for this service account. Only returned on creation, and only when auth_type is api_key.

auth_type.description:
The authentication strategy for the service account:
  * api_key - Regular Khulnasoft API Key.
  * oauth_private_key_jwt - OAuth2 client_credentials grant, using private_key_jwt client_assertion as laid out OIDC Connect Core 1.0, section 9.

client_id.description: The service account's attached client-id. Used to request an access-token. Only provided when auth_type is oauth_private_key_jwt.

jwks_url.description: A JWKs URL used to verify signed JWT requests against. Must be https. Only provided when auth_type is oauth_private_key_jwt.

name.description: A human-friendly name of the service account.

role_id.description: The ID of the role which the Service Account is associated with.

post.description: Manage client secrets for an app.

mode.description:
Operation to perform:
  * `replace` - Replace existing secrets with a new generated
secret
  * `create` - Add a new secret, preserving existing secrets
  * `delete` - Remove an existing secret by value

secret.description: Secret to delete when using `delete` mode

200.description: Secrets have been updated.

get.description:
This endpoint lets you retrieve the SBOM document of a software project.
It supports the following formats:
* CycloneDX version 1.4 in JSON (set `format` to `cyclonedx1.4+json`).
* CycloneDX version 1.4 in XML (set `format` to `cyclonedx1.4+xml`).
* SPDX version 2.3 in JSON (set `format` to `spdx2.3+json`).

By default it will respond with an empty JSON:API response.

200.description: Returns the SBOM document of a project

post.description: Create a service account for an organization. The service account can be used to generate access tokens.

parameters.description: The ID of the Khulnasoft Org that is creating and owns the service account
parameters.name: org_id

access_token_ttl_seconds.description: The time, in seconds, that a generated access token will be valid for. Defaults to 1 hour if unset. Only used when auth_type is oauth_private_key_jwt.

auth_type.description:
Authentication strategy for the service account:
  * api_key - Regular Khulnasoft API Key.
  * oauth_private_key_jwt - OAuth2 client_credentials grant, using private_key_jwt client_assertion as laid out in OIDC Connect Core 1.0, section 9.

jwks_url.description: A JWKs URL hosting your public keys, used to verify signed JWT requests. Must be https. Required only when auth_type is oauth_private_key_jwt.

name.description: A human-friendly name for the service account.

role_id.description: The ID of the role which the created service account should use. Obtained in the Khulnasoft UI, via "Group Page" -> "Settings" -> "Member Roles" -> "Create new Role". Can be shared among multiple accounts.

access_token_ttl_seconds.description: The time, in seconds, that a generated access token will be valid for. Defaults to 1hr if unset. Only provided when auth_type is oauth_private_key_jwt.

api_key.description: The Khulnasoft API Key for this service account. Only returned on creation, and only when auth_type is api_key.

auth_type.description:
The authentication strategy for the service account:
  * api_key - Regular Khulnasoft API Key.
  * oauth_private_key_jwt - OAuth2 client_credentials grant, using private_key_jwt client_assertion as laid out OIDC Connect Core 1.0, section 9.

client_id.description: The service account's attached client-id. Used to request an access-token. Only provided when auth_type is oauth_private_key_jwt.

jwks_url.description: A JWKs URL used to verify signed JWT requests against. Must be https. Only provided when auth_type is oauth_private_key_jwt.

name.description: A human-friendly name of the service account.

role_id.description: The ID of the role which the Service Account is associated with.

sunset.description:

tags.description:
A versioning schema is a system for identifying and organizing different versions of a project. 
It is used to track changes and updates to the project over time, and to help users identify which version they are using. 
A versioning schema typically consists of a series of numbers or labels that are incremented to reflect the progression of versions. 
For example, a versioning schema might use a series of numbers, such as "1.0", "1.1", "2.0", and so on, to indicate major and minor releases of a product. 
A consistent and well-defined versioning schema helps users and tools understand and track the development of a project.
tags.name: Versioning Schema
